alert.note: Alert for Clark; Madison (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 12:43PM EST until February 20 at 11:48AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Ford Lock affecting Clark and Madison Counties. .Heavy rain from earlier this week is causing the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Ford Lock. * WHEN...From this evening to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, flooding occurs in low lying portions of Fort Boonesborough State Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Saturday the stage was 24.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 26.6 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.9 feet on 02/26/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued by midday Sunday.
